availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Native of Harlan County, Kentucky. Son of James Oaks and Mary Napier Oaks. Married to Lavina Oaks. Father of Sarah J. Oaks, Mary Oaks, Miranda Oaks and William Oaks. Resident of Breathitt County in 1850. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1860. Served as a sergeant in the 14th Kentucky Cavalry from June 15, 1863 to March 24, 1864. Served as a first lieutenant in the Three Forks Battalion from December 3, 1864 to July 17, 1865.
